better. not only are her poems brilliantly made, but they also give great pleasure. rarely are those two qualities seen together in one poet." the critic robert buttel wrote that in Brigit Pegeen Kelly 's poems, spiritual certainty or any connection with divinity remains elusive, but still, in dealing with nature and everyday occurrences, "she experiences uncanny, fortuitous moments that have all the revelatory impact of epiphanies."
